page.title: 08SOUTH SELSEY'S BUILDINGS
page.content: Selsey has a variety of types of buildings.On a walk around our part we counted nine{thatched houses.}There are a number of new{bungalows}and two new estates both overlooking the sea.Other houses are old and mainly large. Several of these have been converted into{flats}or{Rest Homes. One of the{cottages}we found interesting was{Paisley Cottage. Hidden amongst the trees the cottage is set in a large garden with big iron gates.It is mock Tudor in style,and has round windows like milk bottle tops.The house is decorated with black and white clubs (as on playing cards).On one side of the front door is a picture of the Selsey Tram,on the other,the Chichester Market Cross.The windows are of leaded light panes. Inside the house is decorated with Paisley wall paper.
